moves.1. e4: The only way to get better at a game is to review your mistakes. I lost so I must have made some; Thus, I am annotating this game. Feel free to give any constructive criticism for a move you thought was bad or could have been done better. I'd appreciate it.
moves.1... b6: This was before I learned how to play the sicilian properly. I would have played c5 instead of b6.
moves.3... Nc6: Also developing, while attacking a pawn.
moves.6... h6: To end all thoughts of Bg5 or Ng5.
moves.7. h4: ? I thought that pressing pawns where you castle is bad...am I wrong?
moves.7... Qd7: I planned on castling queen-side, so I moved the queen there.
moves.9... Bxb4: Thinking back, I think this was a mistake. I thought I could press the pawns through... but couldn't.
moves.13. O-O: He castles. Possibly to get the f Rook involved and/or king safety.
moves.14... Qb5: I think this might have been a mistake.
moves.15. dxc5: He's up. Why not trade off?
moves.15... bxc5: I think this was the best response.
moves.18... d4: Nxc5 or Bxc5 followed by Bxf3 weakens king side defense...
moves.19. Nd2: At this point I saw no chance for black and resigned. Hope you enjoyed!
